thread.title: Man accused of role in 9/11 attack may be his own lawyer
thread.title_full: Man accused of role in 9/11 attack may be his own lawyer - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Man accused of role in 9/11 attack may be his own lawyer
text:
Janet Hamlin/ap Walid Bin Attash is seen in a 2009 court room sketch. A Guantanamo Bay prisoner who is facing trial by military commission in the 9/11 attack told a judge Monday he may want to represent himself, a declaration that prompted a quick end to a bid to get the stalled proceedings moving.
Yemeni prisoner Walid Bin Attash told the judge he wanted to know more about the procedures involved in representing himself, indicating that he was frustrated with his court-appointed lawyers, a civilian and a member of the military.
The judge, Army Col. James Pohl, reserved decision.
Bin Attash and four co-defendants have been charged for their alleged roles planning and aiding the Sept. 11 attack.
